璫字的基本解释

璫
dāng
见“珰”。

璫字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dāng］
［《廣韻》都郎切，平唐，端。］
“珰1”的繁体字。
(1)古代妇女的耳饰。
(2)借指宦官。汉代宦官充武职者，其冠用璫和貂尾为饰，故后代用称宦官。
(3)瓦当。屋椽头的装饰。
(4)见“璫琅”、“璫璫”。
(5)见“琅璫”。

璫字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　璫； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页743第06
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?都郞切，音當。【說文】華飾也。　又【廣韻】耳珠。【集韻】充耳也。【古詩·爲焦仲卿妻作】腰若流紈素，耳著明月璫。　又【前漢·宦者傳】秦漢中常侍參用士人冠，皆銀璫左貂。明帝攺金璫右貂，悉用奄人爲之。【後漢·輿服志】中常侍冠加黃金璫，附蟬爲文，貂尾爲飾。　又璧璫。【前漢·司馬相如傳】華榱璧璫。【師古註】璧璫以玉爲椽頭。當卽所謂璇題，玉題者也。一曰以玉飾瓦之當也。【文選·班固·西都賦】裁金璧以飾璫。【註】璫，椽頭飾也。　又金琅璫，鈴鐸也。【杜甫詩】夜深殿突兀，風動金琅璫。【正韻】亦作鋃鐺。　又丁璫，玉佩聲。【詩緝】玉佩鳴丁璫。【韻會】一作丁當。一作丁東。　又琅璫，鎖也。詳琅字註。　又草名。【詩·周南·采采卷耳疏】卷耳如婦人耳中璫。今或謂之耳璫。

珰
Basic explanation of words
珰
dāng
See "珰".
珰
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dāng］
["Guangyun" Du Langqie, Ping Tang, Duan. ]
Traditional characters for "珰1".
(1) Earrings of ancient women.
(2) By referring to the eunuch. The eunuchs in the Han dynasty were appointed as military officials, and their crowns were decorated with 珰 and sable tails, so their descendants were called eunuchs.
(3) Wadang. Decoration of house rafters.
(4) See "珰lang", "珰珰".
(5) See "Langyan".
珰

[Won Collection 1] [Jade Character Department] 　珰; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 743 Page 06
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Positive Rhyme]? All are cut and sound. [Said Wen] Hua decorated also.　[Guangyun] Ear beads. 【Ji Yun】Fun your ears. [Ancient Poetry·For Jiao Zhongqing's Wife] The waist is like a thin waist, with a bright moon in the ears.　[Previous Han·Euan Zhe Biography] In the Qin and Han Dynasties, the servants were crowned with scholars, all of which were silver and left mink. The Ming emperor called Jin Xuan You Diao, all he used to be survivors. [Later Han·Yufuzhi] Zhongchang servant crown with golden scorpion, with cicada as text, and mink tail as ornament.　 Then Biyong. [Previous Han·Sima Xiangru Biography] Hua Lubi. [Shigu Note] Bisuo uses jade as its rafter. When the so-called Xuan questions, jade questions are also. One said that it is a good idea to decorate tiles with jade. 【Selected Works·Bangu·Xidufu】Cut Jinbi for decoration. 【Note】Yuan, rafter headwear also.　Golden Langluo again, Ling Duo also. [Poems of Du Fu] The hall is abrupt in the middle of the night, and the wind is moving with golden langyan. [Positive rhyme] also used as a clang.　Ding Yan again, the sound of jade pendant. [Poems] Jade Pei Ming Ding Yan. [Rhyme Club] A jingle. One is Ding Dong.　Lang Ling again, lock also. Detailed lang word note.　Also cursive name. 【Poetry·Zhou Nan·Cai Cai Juan Er Shu】The ear curl is like a swan in the ears of a woman. Today may be called the ear 珰.
